== Description ==

<tt>register_url</tt> is a filter applied to the URL returned by the function <tt>[[Function Reference/wp_registration_url|wp_registration_url()]]</tt>, which allows you to have that function direct users to a specific (different) URL for registration.

== Parameters ==

{{Parameter|$register_url|string|The URL for registration}}

== Examples ==

The following example would return a registration URL <nowiki>http://mydomain.com/register/</nowiki> for the <tt>wp_registration_url()</tt> function:
<pre>
add_filter( 'register_url', 'my_register_page' );
function my_register_page( $register_url ) {
    return home_url( '/register/' );
}
</pre>

== Notes ==
The URL that is passed to this filter is generated by <tt>[[Function_Reference/site_url|site_url]]</tt> using the 'login' <tt>$scheme</tt>:
<pre>site_url( 'wp-login.php?action=register', 'login' )</pre>
